subject: Grounding issue
description_text:
Pedals are jumping like crazy, how do i ground them to my rig ? Didnt come
with a ground cable

conversations.body_text: Hi Luke Maguire,     Which model of the pedal are you using? If possible, could you provide a video?  In general, if you are using a Fanatec or Simagic base, there might be electromagnetic interference. We recommend ensuring that your PC or base is properly grounded to your home’s electrical ground. Alternatively, you can also mount the control box securely to a metal bracket near the pedals to help reduce interference.

Im using simagic

On Sun 22 Jun 2025 at 15:35, support@simsonn.com

Hi Luke Maguire,    Are the power plugs for your PC and base three-pronged? If your home power outlets are also three-pronged, they should generally provide good grounding, which helps reduce interference.

They are 3 pronged so there shouldn’t be an issue

On Sun 22 Jun 2025 at 15:53, support@simsonn.com

If i get some earth cable and attached to pedals where would be best to
ground it ?
Hi Luke Maguire,    The silver long coupling nut on the pedal can be connected to the brass standoff on the control box with a wire to provide grounding.
